member.name: IMediaObject.AllocateStreamingResources

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The AllocateStreamingResources method allocates any resources needed by the DMO. Calling this method is always optional.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful. Otherwise, returns an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

member.name: IMediaObject.Discontinuity

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The Discontinuity method signals a discontinuity on the specified input stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

listheader.description: The DMO is not accepting input.
The input and output types have not been set.

member.name: IMediaObject.Flush

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The Flush method flushes all internally buffered data.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful. Otherwise, returns an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

member.name: IMediaObject.FreeStreamingResources

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The FreeStreamingResources method frees resources allocated by the DMO. Calling this method is always optional.

member.returns: Returns S_OK if successful. Otherwise, returns an HRESULT value indicating the cause of the error.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetInputCurrentType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetInputCurrentType method retrieves the media type that was set for an input stream, if any.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a DMO_MEDIA_TYPE structure allocated by the caller. The method fills the structure with the media type.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetInputMaxLatency

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetInputMaxLatency method retrieves the maximum latency on a specified input stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a variable that receives the maximum latency.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetInputSizeInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetInputSizeInfo method retrieves the buffer requirements for a specified input stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a variable that receives the minimum size of an input buffer for this stream, in bytes.
Pointer to a variable that receives the maximum amount of data that the DMO will hold for lookahead, in bytes. If the DMO does not perform lookahead on the stream, the value is zero.
Pointer to a variable that receives the required buffer alignment, in bytes. If the input stream has no alignment requirement, the value is 1.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetInputStatus

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetInputStatus method queries whether an input stream can accept more input data.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a variable that receives either zero or DMO_INPUT_STATUSF_ACCEPT_DATA.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetInputStreamInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]

The GetInputStreamInfo method retrieves information about an input stream, such as any restrictions on the number of samples per buffer, and whether the stream performs lookahead on the input data. This information never changes.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a variable that receives a bitwise combination of zero or more flags.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetInputType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetInputType method retrieves a preferred media type for a specified input stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Zero-based index on the set of acceptable media types.

Pointer to a DMO_MEDIA_TYPE structure allocated by the caller, or NULL. If this parameter is non-NULL, the method fills the structure with the media type. You can use the value NULL to test whether the type index is in range, by checking the return code.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

listheader.description: Type index is out of range.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetOutputCurrentType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetOutputCurrentType method retrieves the media type that was set for an output stream, if any.

member.param: Zero-based index of an output stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a DMO_MEDIA_TYPE structure allocated by the caller. The method fills the structure with the media type.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetOutputSizeInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetOutputSizeInfo method retrieves the buffer requirements for a specified output stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an output stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a variable that receives the minimum size of an output buffer for this stream, in bytes.
Pointer to a variable that receives the required buffer alignment, in bytes. If the output stream has no alignment requirement, the value is 1.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetOutputStreamInfo

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetOutputStreamInfo method retrieves information about an output stream; for example, whether the stream is discardable, and whether it uses a fixed sample size. This information never changes.

member.param: Zero-based index of an output stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a variable that receives a bitwise combination of zero or more flags.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetOutputType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetOutputType method retrieves a preferred media type for a specified output stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an output stream on the DMO.
Zero-based index on the set of acceptable media types.

Pointer to a DMO_MEDIA_TYPE structure allocated by the caller, or NULL. If this parameter is non-NULL, the method fills the structure with the media type. You can use the value NULL to test whether the type index is in range, by checking the return code.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

listheader.description: Type index is out of range.

member.name: IMediaObject.GetStreamCount

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetStreamCount method retrieves the number of input and output streams.

member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of input streams. Cannot be NULL.
Pointer to a variable that receives the number of output streams. Cannot be NULL.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.Lock

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The Lock method acquires or releases a lock on the DMO. Call this method to keep the DMO serialized when performing multiple operations.

member.param: Value that specifies whether to acquire or release the lock. If the value is non-zero, a lock is acquired. If the value is zero, the lock is released.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.ProcessInput

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ProcessInput method delivers a buffer to the specified input stream.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to the buffer's interface.
Bitwise combination of zero or more flags from the enumeration.

Time stamp that specifies the start time of the data in the buffer. If the buffer has a valid time stamp, set the DMO_INPUT_DATA_BUFFERF_TIME flag in the dwFlags parameter. Otherwise, the DMO ignores this value.

Reference time specifying the duration of the data in the buffer. If this value is valid, set the DMO_INPUT_DATA_BUFFERF_TIMELENGTH flag in the dwFlags parameter. Otherwise, the DMO ignores this value.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.ProcessOutput

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ProcessOutput method generates output from the current input data.

member.param: Bitwise combination of zero or more flags from the enumeration.
Number of output buffers.
Pointer to an array of DMO_OUTPUT_DATA_BUFFER structures containing the output buffers. Specify the size of the array in the cOutputBufferCount parameter.
Pointer to a variable that receives a reserved value (zero). The application should ignore this value.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.SetInputMaxLatency

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetInputMaxLatency method sets the maximum latency on a specified input stream. For the definition of maximum latency, see .

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Maximum latency.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

member.name: IMediaObject.SetInputType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetInputType method sets the media type on an input stream, or tests whether a media type is acceptable.

member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a DMO_MEDIA_TYPE structure that specifies the media type.
Bitwise combination of zero or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

listheader.description: Media type was set successfully, or is acceptable

member.name: IMediaObject.SetOutputType

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetOutputType method sets the media type on an output stream, or tests whether a media type is acceptable.

member.param: Zero-based index of an output stream on the DMO.
Pointer to a DMO_MEDIA_TYPE structure that specifies the media type.
Bitwise combination of zero or more flags from the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include those in the following table.

listheader.description: Media type was set successfully, or is acceptable

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IMediaObject interface provides methods for manipulating a Microsoft DirectX Media Object (DMO).
